description: A volcanic crater lake located in the Phlegraean Fields, Lake Avernus served a major ritual role for ancient Romans and Greeks as they viewed it as an entrance to Hades.
details: The Barrington Atlas Directory notes: Lago Averno

history.comment: edited description; added references and connection

names.description: Modern Italian name of the Avernus Lacus, sometimes shortened to "Lago Averno" or occasionally lengthened to "Lago di Averno".
